sen.j: 籾井 教業（もみい のりなり、大永7年（1527年） - 天正4年（1576年））は、戦国時代 (日本)の丹波国の武将。
sen.e: Norinari MOMI (1524 - 1576) was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku Period (Japan) in Tanba-no-kuni.

sen.e: He excelled at a martial art as much as Naomasa AKAI who was called as Red ogre of Tanba and seemed to be called Blue orge, but the existence remains skeptical.

sen.j: 籾井氏は16世紀に丹波国多紀郡の篠山盆地に割拠した新興の豪族。
sen.e: Momi clan was an emerging gozoku who occupied the Sasayama basin in Tanba-no-kuni Taki-gun and expanded its power of influence there in the 16th century, and Momi Castle (currently, Sasayama City area) they were residing was located in a key spot the Sasayama basin was about to meet the Sanindo which ran from Kyoto through Tanba and to the San-in district in ancient and medieval times.

sen.j: 居城の籾井城（現在の篠山市域）は古代・中世に京都から丹波を経て山陰地方に向かう山陰道が篠山盆地に差し掛かる箇所にあたる要衝であった。
sen.e: They resided in Momi Castle (located in the present-day Sasayama City area), which was located in a key spot near the Sasayama basin along the Sanin-do Road, a road which ran from Kyoto through Tanba to the Sanin region in ancient and medieval times.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理。Sanin-do Roadに訂正しました。Sanin regionに訂正しました。ハイフン削除、Saninに訂正しました。NCのコメントに対応して書き換えました。

sen.j: 教業は篠山盆地の中心を抑える八上城（篠山市域）の波多野氏と姻戚関係にあり、その旗下の武将としてともに足利義昭に仕えた。
sen.e: Norinari had marital relationships with the Hatano clan in Yagami Castle (within Sasayama City) which was controlling the center of the Sasayama basin, and worked for Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA as Hatamoto (direct retainer of the shogun) busho (warlord).

sen.j: 1575年、義昭を追放して自身に反抗する丹波の諸将の討伐に取り掛かった織田信長は、明智光秀に命じて丹波の経略に取り掛からせた。
sen.e: After Nobunaga ODA ousted Yoshiaki, he began with subduing several busho (warlords) in Tanba who were opposed to him, and directed Mitsuhide AKECHI to control and govern Tanba in 1575.

sen.j: 丹波への入り口にあたる籾井城は明智勢の猛攻を受け、翌年秋に陥落、籾井氏は没落した。
sen.e: Momi Castle which was composing a gateway to Tanba was heavily attacked from Akechi's forces and collapsed in autumn of the following year, resulting in the ruin of the Momi clan.

sen.j: そして彼は、明智光秀ではなく豊臣秀吉によって籾井城を攻撃されて、落城、戦死したという。
sen.e: And it is believed that he died in war because Momi Castle was destroyed by the attack of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI rather than Mitsuhide AKECHI, but this story is based on Momi-ke nikki (Diary of Momi Family), other sources, etc. that have been believed to be personally written by the offspring of former retainers of the Hatano clan and the Momi clan who survived in a civilian society through the Edo era, and seems difficult to be all considered historical facts.
